result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevis James Rothschadl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevis James Rothschadl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevis James Rothschadl was found guilty of Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to report to probation no later than 11/2/22 at 9:00 AM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevis James Rothschadl

records.addlTxt: w/ Agreement attached. Signed by DE and Atty. Nelson. kma
Filed by Atty A Nelson. Includes 22CF578, 22CM333. jaf

2:32 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Trevis James Rothschadl in court. Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Trevis James Rothschadl. INCLUDES 22CF578, 22CM333 and 22CM384. ADA Ballo recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in Cts 2,3,4 and 5 in 22CM578 and case 22CM384 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 2:54 PM. kma

Court orders: 
22CF578 
Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages
S/W 18 months probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- No contact with Elizabeth S.
- No abusive contact with Jackie B.
- Comply with mental health treatment plan
- No unsupervised contact with minors under age 18, except as authorized by Agent
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

22CM333
Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier
S/W 18 months probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- No contact with Elizabeth S.
- No abusive contact with Jackie B.
- Comply with mental health treatment plan
- No unsupervised contact with minors under age 18, except as authorized by Agent
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100; payable through Clerk of Court

OFF RECORD FOR SCHEDULING   Defendant Trevis James Rothschadl in court.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Trevis James Rothschadl.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E.L.B.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
